name: Computer Services
description: Companies that provide consulting or integration services to other businesses relating to information technology. Includes providers of computer-system design, systems integration, network and systems operations, cloud computing, distributed ledger technology (DLT) consulting and integration, data management and storage, repair services and technical support.

name: Software
description: Publishers and distributors of computer software for home or corporate use. Excludes computer game producers, which are classified under Electronic Entertainment.

name: Consumer Digital Services
description: Companies involved in digital platforms that primarily generate revenue from advertising, content delivery and other virtual products for consumers. To a lesser extent they generate subscription fee revenue through related services offered by the platform and/or by the advertisers to utilize data content and customer insight.

name: Semiconductors
description: Producers and distributors of semiconductors and other integrated chips, including other products related to the semiconductor industry, such as semiconductor capital equipment and motherboards.  Excludes makers of printed circuit boards, which are classified under Electronic Components

name: Electronic Components
description: Companies involved in the application of high-technology parts to finished products, including printed circuit boards. Excludes communications-related equipment, which are classified under Telecommunications Equipment Subsector and technology parts for consumer electronics, which are classified under Electrical Components.

name: Production Technology Equipment
description: Manufactures of high-technology tools and/or equipments that are used in the creation of semiconductors, photonics, wafers, and other high-technology components.

name: Computer Hardware
description: Manufacturers and distributors of computers, servers, mainframes, workstations and other computer hardware and subsystems, such as mass-storage drives, mice, keyboards and printers. Companies in this group can provide diverse applications for consumer and commercial use. Including companies providing computing hardware for cryptocurrency mining.

name: Electronic Office Equipment
description: Manufacturers and distributors of electronic office equipment, including photocopiers and fax machines.

name: Telecommunications Equipment
description: Makers and distributors of high-technology communication products, including mobile telephones, fibers optics, switching devices, local and wide-area networks, teleconferencing equipment and connectivity devices for computers, including hubs and routers.

name: Cable Television Services
description: Companies that primarily distribute media content through their own cable and wireless network infrastructure, such as wired cable, fiber-optic, and satellite networks.

name: Telecommunications Services
description: Providers of mobile and fixed-line telephone services, paging services, and VOIP providers. Including companies that own and operate telecommunication assets. Telecommunication Services companies can also provide supplemental services such as direct internet access, VPN services, colocation services and transit services.

name: Health Care Facilities
description: Owners and operators of primary healthcare property, community hospitals, retirement homes, nursing homes, and related medical businesses.

name: Health Care Management Services
description: Companies that offers managed health care benefits and services (e.g., Health Management Organizations (HMO) including state sponsored programs

name: Health Care Services
description: Companies that provide various specialized disease management services to physicians, health plans, and hospitals. Primary business lines in this category can also include general consultation services, paramedical services, operation of health portals and distribution of health food products.

name: Health Care: Misc.
description: Includes Healthcare companies that are not classified in the Healthcare Facilities, Healthcare Management Services or Healthcare Services

name: Medical Equipment
description: Manufacturers and distributors of medical devices such as MRI scanners, prosthetics, pacemakers, X-ray machines and other non-disposable medical devices.

name: Medical Supplies
description: Manufacturers and distributors of medical supplies used by health care providers and the general public. Includes makers of contact lenses, eyeglass lenses, bandages and other disposable medical supplies.

name: Medical Services
description: Companies that operate and manage medical labs and testing services.

name: Biotechnology
description: Companies engaged in research into and development of biological substances for the purposes of drug discovery and diagnostic development, and which derive the majority of their revenue from either the sale or licensing of these drugs and diagnostic tools.

name: Pharmaceuticals
description: Manufacturers of prescription or over-the-counter drugs, such as aspirin, cold remedies and birth control pills. Includes vaccine producers but excludes vitamin producers, which are classified under Food Products.

name: Cannabis Producers
description: Companies that engage in cannabis cultivation, cannabis distribution including dispensaries, the processing and distribution of cannabis plants, and the creation of cannabis derivative products.  Companies that primarily engage in the research, development and manufacturing of cannabis (THC/CBD) based drugs are classified in the Biotechnology or the Pharmaceuticals Subsector.

name: Banks
description: Primary activities involve retail banking and/or commercial banking. Attracts deposits from the general public and provide various financial services.

name: Consumer Lending
description: Companies that provide financial services to consumers including payday loans, student loans, automobile loans, etc.

name: Mortgage Finance
description: Companies that provide mortgages, mortgage insurance and other related services

name: Financial Data Providers
description: Companies provide financial decision support tools for investment institutions. Including financial database operators and index data providers.

name: Diversified Financial Services
description: Companies providing a diversified range of services such as  investment banking, trading, and asset management. Diversified Investment Holding companies engaged in acquiring equity stake of listed securities are also classified in this group.

name: Asset Managers and Custodians
description: Companies that provide custodial, trustee and other related fiduciary services. i.e. mutual fund and private investment management. Also includes companies engaged in private equity and venture capital.

name: Investment Services
description: Companies that provide trading and brokerage services for financial assets such as equities, commodities, debts, currency, cryptocurrency. Also includes the operators of stock, currency, and other financial market exchanges.

name: Mortgage REITs: Diversified
description: Mortgage REITs that invest in a combination of segments with no specific dominance over one or the other

name: Mortgage REITs: Commercial
description: REITs primarily involved in lending money to commercial real estate owners and operators directly or indirectly through the purchase of mortgages, mortgage backed securities and other mortgage related assets

name: Mortgage REITs: Residential
description: REITs primarily involved in lending money to residential real estate owners and operators directly or indirectly through the purchase of mortgages, mortgage backed securities and other mortgage related assets

name: Closed End Investments
description: Corporate closed-ended investment entities identified under distinguishing legislation, such as investment trusts and venture capital trusts.

name: Open End and Miscellaneous Investment Vehicles
description: Cash shells, Special Purpose Acquisition Company (SPACs), Non corporate investment entities such as open-ended funds, unit trusts and ETFs and currency funds and split capital trusts.

name: Life Insurance
description: Companies engaged principally in life and health insurance.

name: Full Line Insurance
description: Companies that provide a wide range of insurance products such as a combination of life, property/casualty, and specialty insurance

name: Insurance Brokers
description: Insurance brokers and agents

name: Reinsurance
description: Companies engaged principally in reinsurance.

name: Property and Casualty Insurance
description: Companies engaged principally in accident, fire, automotive, marine, malpractice and other classes of nonlife insurance.

name: Real Estate Holding and Development
description: Companies that invest directly or indirectly in a variety of types of properties without a concentration on any single type

name: Real Estate Services
description: Companies that provide services to real estate companies but do not own the properties themselves. Includes agencies, brokers, leasing companies, management companies and advisory services.

name: Diversified REITs
description: REITS that invest in a combination of other defined REIT categories

name: Health Care REITs
description: REITs that primarily invest in health care facilities including hospitals, nursing homes and assisted living properties

name: Hotel and Lodging REITs
description: REITS that primarily invest in hotels, motels, resorts or other lodging properties

name: Industrial REITs
description: REITs that primarily invest in industrial properties including industrial warehouses and distribution properties

name: Infrastructure REITs
description: REITS that primarily invest in infrastructure assets including roads, bridges, tunnels, airports, power generation, fuels, pipelines, water and waste management, and communication assets

name: Office REITs
description: REITs that primarily invest in office properties

name: Residential REITs
description: REITs that primarily invest in residential properties including manufactured homes, multifamily homes, apartments, and student housing properties

name: Retail REITs
description: REITs that primarily invest in retail properties including malls, shopping centers, neighborhood and community shopping centers, strip malls, free standing stores, and factory outlets

name: Storage REITs
description: REITs that primarily invest in public self-storage properties

name: Timber REITs
description: REITS that primarily invest in timberland and timber-related products and activities

name: Other Specialty REITs
description: REITs that primarily invest in any single type of facility or property not specifically defined within another REITs industry

name: Auto Services
description: Companies that provide assistance to individual vehicle owners

name: Tires
description: Manufacturers, distributors and re-treaders of automobile, truck and motorcycle tires.

name: Automobiles
description: Makers of passenger vehicles, including cars, sport utility vehicles (SUVs) and light trucks. Excludes makers of heavy trucks and makers of recreational vehicles (RVs and ATVs).

name: Auto Parts
description: Manufacturers and distributors of new and replacement parts for motorcycles and automobiles, such as engines, carburetors and batteries. Excludes producers of tires, which are classified under Tires.

name: Education Services
description: Companies that own and manage higher education systems, post-secondary degree programs or other educational services

name: Funeral Parlors and Cemetery
description: Companies that own and operate funeral homes, cemeteries, crematoriums and/or provide other funeral services.

name: Printing and Copying Services
description: Companies specializing in printing, copying and/or similar solutions for individuals and small businesses

name: Rental and Leasing Services: Consumer
description: Companies that lease automobiles, appliances, electronics or furniture to consumers

name: Storage Facilities
description: Companies that own and operate storage facilities (does not include companies structured as REITs

name: Vending and Catering Service
description: Companies that provide catering and food service and/or food ingredients to individuals or institutions

name: Consumer Services: Misc.
description: Consumer Services companies that are not categorized in the Education Services, Funeral Parlors and Cemeteries, Printing and Copying Services, Rental and Leasing Services, Storage Facilities or Vending and Catering Services categories

name: Home Construction
description: Constructors of residential homes, including manufacturers of mobile and prefabricated homes intended for use in one place.

name: Household Furnishings
description: Manufacturers and distributors of furniture, including chairs, tables, desks, and office furniture.

name: Household Appliance
description: Companies that manufacture and market household electrical appliances.

name: Household Equipment and Products
description: Companies that manufacture and supply various household products. Includes manufacturers of gardening tools, kitchen utensils, dishes and other home related products

name: Consumer Electronics
description: Companies primarily involved in the application of technology and electronics to the consumer discretionary sector.

name: Electronic Entertainment
description: Companies that design, manufacture and market video game software and related elements. Also includes consumer entertainment technology, e.g. Dolby

name: Toys
description: Manufacturers and distributors of toys and games as playing cards, board games, stuffed animals and dolls.

name: Recreational Products
description: Manufacturers and distributors of recreational equipment not classified in other Leisure Goods categories, including Musical  Instruments

name: Recreational Vehicles and Boats
description: Companies that design, manufacture and market recreation vehicles (RVs), motorcycles or passenger boats

name: Photography
description: Companies that produce and/or market professional and/or personal imaging products including digital cameras and film cameras

name: Clothing and Accessories
description: Manufacturers and distributors of all types of clothing and accessories. Includes sportswear, sunglasses, eyeglass frames, leather clothing and goods, and processors of hides and skins. Excludes jewelry, which is categorized under Luxury Items

name: Footwear
description: Manufacturers and distributors of shoes, boots, sandals, sneakers and other types of footwear.

name: Luxury Items
description: Companies that manufacture and market jewelry, watches and gemstones.

name: Cosmetics
description: Companies that produce and market make-up and fragrance products (perfume).  Excludes personal care products, which are classified under Consumer Staples

name: Entertainment
description: Companies that provide various media services including feature films, music and television shows and stations

name: Media Agencies
description: Companies that provide a wide range of marketing and public relations services such as promoting advertising space in telephone and professional directories, analyzing market research and other various marketing activities.  Excluding website design/publishing, which are classified under the Consumer Digital Services Subsector.

name: Publishing
description: Companies that provide advertising and publishing services to customers in industrial, commercial, and design markets.  This includes companies that publish books, magazines, comics, encyclopedias, financial reports, journals and/or newspapers

name: Radio and TV Broadcasters
description: Companies with principal activities that include operating commercial TV stations and/or radio broadcasting

name: Diversified Retailers
description: Retail outlets and wholesalers offering a wide variety of products including both hard goods and soft goods.

name: Apparel Retailers
description: Retailers and wholesalers specializing mainly in clothing, shoes, jewelry, sunglasses and other accessories.

name: Home Improvement Retailers
description: Retailers and wholesalers concentrating on the sale of home improvement products, including garden equipment, carpets, wallpaper, paint, home furniture, blinds and curtains, and building materials.

name: Specialty Retailers
description: Retailers and wholesalers concentrating on a single class of goods, such as electronics, books, automotive parts or closeouts. Includes automobile dealerships, duty-free shops and automotive fuel stations not owned by oil companies.  Excludes Apparel and Home Improvement Retailers

name: Airlines
description: Companies providing primarily passenger air transport. Excludes airport operators and air freight transport, which are classified under 50206040 - Delivery Services.

name: Travel and Tourism
description: Companies providing travel and tourism related services, including travel agents, online travel reservation services, and companies that provide passenger transportation for leisure are included, such as tour buses, leisure cruisers and railways, and taxis. Excludes mass public transportation services which are classified under Industrial Transportation Sector.

name: Casinos and Gambling
description: Providers of gambling and casino facilities. Includes online casinos, racetracks and the manufacturers of pachinko machines and casino and lottery equipment.

name: Hotels and Motels
description: Operators and managers of hotels, motels, lodges, resorts, spas and campgrounds.

name: Recreational Services
description: Providers of leisure facilities and services, including fitness centers, amusement parks, concerts and sports/e-sports event promotion. Also includes companies that own and manage professional sports teams.

name: Restaurants and Bars
description: Operators of restaurants, fast-food facilities, coffee shops and bars. Includes integrated brewery companies.  Excludes catering companies, which are classified as Vending and Catering Service.

name: Brewers
description: Manufacturers and shippers of cider or malt products such as beer, ale and stout.

name: Distillers and Vintners
description: Producers, distillers, vintners, blenders and shippers of wine and spirits such as whisky, brandy, rum, gin or liqueurs.

name: Soft Drinks
description: Manufacturers, bottlers and distributors of non-alcoholic beverages, such as soda, fruit juices, tea, coffee and bottled water.

name: Farming, Fishing, Ranching and Plantations
description: Companies that grow crops or raise livestock, operate fisheries or own nontobacco plantations. Includes manufacturers of livestock feeds and seeds and other agricultural products

name: Food Products
description: Food producers, including meatpacking, snacks, fruits, vegetables, dairy products and frozen seafood. Includes producers of pet food and manufacturers of dietary supplements, vitamins and related items. Excludes producers of fruit juices, tea, coffee, bottled water and other non-alcoholic beverages, which are classified under Soft Drinks.

name: Fruit and Grain Processing
description: Companies involved in the value-adding process of various raw or unprocessed agricultural products.  May also produce and market such products.

name: Sugar
description: Companies that grow, refine, process and distribute sugar

name: Tobacco
description: Manufacturers and distributors of cigarettes, cigars and other tobacco products. Includes tobacco plantations.

name: Food Retailers and Wholesalers
description: Supermarkets, food-oriented convenience stores and other food retailers and distributors. Includes retailers of dietary supplements and vitamins.

name: Drug Retailers
description: Operators of pharmacies, including wholesalers and distributors catering to these businesses.

name: Personal Products
description: Makers and distributors of toiletries and personal-care and hygiene products, including deodorants, soaps, toothpaste, perfumes, diapers, shampoos, razors, condoms and feminine-hygiene products. Excludes makers of hormonal (oral or injection) and implants (intrauterine devices) and contraceptives, which are classified under the Pharmaceuticals Subsector.

name: Nondurable Household Products
description: Producers and distributors of pens, paper goods, batteries, light bulbs, tissues, toilet paper and cleaning products such as soaps and polishes.

name: Miscellaneous Consumer Staple Goods
description: Includes Consumer Staples companies that are not classified in any other Consumer Staples industry

name: Construction
description: Companies that provide construction and infrastructure development services to private and/or public sector clients.

name: Engineering and Contracting Services
description: Companies that provide capital project planning and solutions.  Includes engineering contracts, infrastructure development, bid preparation, interior enhancement designs and architects.

name: Building, Roofing/Wallboard and Plumbing
description: Companies that design, manufacture, market and/or install non-climate control systems and related products such as siding, windows and water pipes.

name: Building: Climate Control
description: Companies that design, manufacture, market and/or install air conditioning, heating and/or refrigeration systems

name: Cement
description: Companies primarily engaged in manufacturing and distributing cement and cement-derived products

name: Building Materials: Other
description: Companies that provide materials to the building and construction industry, excluding air-conditioning, cement, heating, plumbing, roofing, and wall boards

name: Aerospace
description: Manufacturers, assemblers and distributors of aircraft and aircraft parts, including communication satellite,  used in commercial or private air and/or space transport.

name: Defense
description: Producers of components and equipment for the defense industry, including military aircraft, radar equipment and weapons. Also included are companies that primarily provide services to the defense industry.

name: Electrical Components
description: Makers and distributors of basic electrical parts for finished products such as radios, televisions and other consumer electronics. Includes makers of cables, wires, ceramics, transistors, and electric adapters. Excludes communications-related equipment, which are classified under Telecommunications Equipment and makers of high-technology parts, which are classified under Electronic Components Subsector.

name: Electronic Equipment: Control and Filter
description: Companies primarily  involved in providing mechanical and electronic security and/or filtration systems

name: Electronic Equipment: Gauges and Meters
description: Companies that design, manufacture and market products used to measure electric, gas, water, imaging, and other data for use in a variety of industries.

name: Electronic Equipment: Pollution Control
description: Companies primarily engaged in the production of pollution control equipment for purification of air and liquids.

name: Electronic Equipment: Other
description: Companies that specialize in the development and production of electrical devices/components marketed to business clients.

name: Diversified Industrials
description: Companies engaged in three or more industrial business activities, none of which is the dominant business line

name: Paints and Coatings
description: Companies that manufacture and distribute paint, material coatings, and resins

name: Plastics
description: Companies that manufacture and market plastic products or chemicals used to make plastic

name: Glass
description: Companies that manufacture various structural glasses such as float glass, architectural glass, delicacy glass, automotive glass, and other glass products. Glass containers/bottles prepared for other markets are classified in 50203030 - Containers and Packaging. Specialized glass for application in electronics are classified in 10102015 - Electronic Components.

name: Containers and Packaging
description: Companies that may produces a wide range of packaging products and packaging related materials, including  cartons, plastic bottles, jars, glass bottles,  aluminum cans, dispensing pumps, aerosol valves, etc.

name: Machinery: Industrial
description: Companies that design, develop, manufacture, sell, and support general industrial machines and parts. This excludes all the other machinery subsectors specified

name: Machinery: Agricultural
description: Manufacturers and distributers of a range of farming equipment for irrigation, harvesting, plowing and other processes

name: Machinery: Construction and Handling
description: Companies that design, manufacture and market large-size industrial equipment for construction and ports.

name: Machinery: Engines
description: Companies that manufacture and distribute energy output devices and component parts, including diesel engines and gas engines

name: Machinery: Tools
description: Companies that manufactures and market value-adding equipment for various heavy industries

name: Machinery: Specialty
description: Companies that design, manufacture and market a specific type or group of industrial machines and parts. This excludes all the other Machinery industries categorized in the Machinery subsector.

name: Industrial Suppliers
description: Distributors and wholesalers of diversified products and equipment primarily used in the commercial and industrial sectors. Includes builder's merchants and companies providing  Maintenance/Repair services.

name: Transaction Processing Services
description: Providers of computerized transaction processing services. Includes companies that engages in any aspects of global payment services such as routing of payment information and related data services that facilitate the authorization, clearing, and settlement of transactions. Includes card network operators, issuer and acquirer processors.

name: Professional Business Support Services
description: Companies that provide outsourced business operation services. This includes consulting services, corporate taxes, and business decision tools such as credit monitoring and KYC database service. Credit Agencies and Rating firms are classified under the Financial Data Providers Subsector.

name: Business Training and Employment Agencies
description: Providers of business or management training courses and employment services. Includes online job search companies.

name: Forms and Bulk Printing Services
description: Companies that provide printed business products including forms, checks, labels and IDs

name: Security Services
description: Companies that provide security services, install, service and monitor alarm and security systems.

name: Trucking
description: Companies that provide commercial trucking or mass public bus services. Excludes road and tunnel operators, which are classified under Transportation Services Subsector.

name: Commercial Vehicles and Parts
description: Companies that design, develop, manufacture, and distribute light, medium and heavy duty trucks and vans.  Also includes related aftermarket distribution of parts

name: Railroads
description: Companies that operate railway systems for transporting goods and mass public rail services.

name: Railroad Equipment
description: Companies that manufacture, supply and distribute railroad supplies

name: Marine Transportation
description: Providers of on-water transportation for commercial markets, such as container shipping. Also includes shipbuilders. Excludes ports, which are classified under Transportation Services.

name: Delivery Services
description: Operators of mail and package delivery services for commercial and consumer use. Includes courier and logistic services primarily involving air transportation.

name: Commercial Vehicle-Equipment Leasing
description: Companies that rents and lease operational equipment to commercial clients, such as: rails, tankers, freight cars, related equipment plus aviation assets (jets and airplanes).

name: Transportation Services
description: Companies providing services to the Industrial Transportation sector, including companies that manage airports, train depots, roads, bridges, tunnels, ports, and providers of logistic services to shippers of goods. Includes companies that provide aircraft and vehicle maintenance services.

name: Diversified Materials
description: Companies involved in manufacturing a diversified range of  materials (e.g.,  bauxite, abrasive materials and composite material)

name: Forestry
description: Owners and operators of timber tracts, forest tree nurseries and sawmills. Excludes providers of finished wood products such as wooden beams, which are classified under Building Materials.  Also excludes timber REITs, which are classified under Real Estate.

name: Paper
description: Companies that manufacture and market paper products including office paper, cardboard, tissue paper, newsprint, commercial pulp, etc.

name: Textile Products
description: Companies that produce and distribute various textile products such as cotton yarns, denims, and other finished fabrics.

name: General Mining
description: Companies engaged in the exploration, extraction or refining of minerals not defined elsewhere within the Mining sector. Also includes companies engaged in diversified metals and mining, marketing of mining commodities,and providers of contracted drilling services. Excludes companies that primarily provide services to Oil and Gas companies which are classified in the Oil Equipment and Services Subsector and companies that mine, process and market coal, which are classified under Coal Subsector.

name: Iron and Steel
description: Companies that mine for iron ore and companies that produce, process, and distribute steel products.  This can include welding consumables, strip steel, rods, bars, wires, piping, tubing, rails, and structural products as well as sheets and coils

name: Metal Fabricating
description: Companies that manufacture and supply fabricated metal components such as, rings, piping materials, hinges, springs,   etc.

name: Aluminum
description: Companies that mine or process bauxite or manufacture and distribute aluminum bars, rods and other products for use by other industries. Excludes manufacturers of finished aluminum products, such as siding, which are categorized according to the type of end product.

name: Copper
description: Companies primarily involved in the mining, extraction and distribution of copper and related minerals

name: Nonferrous Metals
description: Producers and traders of metals and primary metal products other than iron, aluminum and steel. Excludes companies that make finished products, which are categorized according to the type of end product.

name: Diamonds and Gemstones
description: Companies engaged in the exploration for and production of diamonds and other gemstones.

name: Gold Mining
description: Prospectors for and extractors or refiners of gold-bearing ores.

name: Platinum and Precious Metals
description: Companies engaged in the exploration for and production of platinum, silver and other precious metals not defined elsewhere.

name: Chemicals: Diversified
description: Companies that manufacture and market a diversified range of industrial chemicals

name: Chemicals and Synthetic Fibers
description: Companies that manufacture and distribute chemical fibers for various applications

name: Fertilizers
description: Companies that manufacture and market nitrogen fertilizers and other agricultural chemicals

name: Specialty Chemicals
description: Companies that manufacture and market a specific type or group of chemicals elsewhere in the Chemicals subsector

name: Integrated Oil and Gas
description: Companies that engage in all three fields of petroleum production: Extraction (upstream), Transportation (midstream), and Refining and Marketing (downstream).

name: Oil: Crude Producers
description: Companies engaged in the exploration for and drilling, production, and supply of crude oil on land

name: Offshore Drilling and Other Services
description: Companies that primarily explore and drill for oil and gas in offshore areas.

name: Oil Refining and Marketing
description: Companies primarily engaged in the refining and marketing of petroleum products (downstream).

name: Oil Equipment and Services
description: Suppliers of equipment and services to oil fields and offshore platforms, such as drilling, exploration, seismic-information services and platform construction.

name: Pipelines
description: Operators of pipelines carrying oil, gas or other forms of fuel. Excludes pipeline operators that derive the majority of their revenues from direct sales to end users, which are classified under Gas Distribution.

name: Coal
description: Companies that mine, process and market coal

name: Alternative Fuels
description: Companies that produce alternative fuels such as ethanol, methanol, hydrogen and bio-fuels that are mainly used to power vehicles, and companies that are involved in the production of vehicle fuel cells and/or the development of alternative fueling infrastructure.

name: Renewable Energy Equipment
description: Companies that develop or manufacture renewable energy equipment utilizing sources such as solar, wind, tidal, geothermal, hydro and waves.

name: Alternative Electricity
description: Companies generating and distributing electricity from a renewable source. Includes companies that produce solar, water, wind and geothermal electricity.

name: Conventional Electricity
description: Companies generating and distributing electricity through the burning of fossil fuels such as coal, petroleum and natural gas, and through nuclear energy.

name: Multi-Utilities
description: Companies that engage in multiple utilities that have no particular dominance over one another.

name: Gas Distribution
description: Distributors of gas to end users. Excludes providers of natural gas as a commodity, which are classified under the Oil and Gas industry.

name: Water
description: Companies providing water to end users, including water treatment plants.

name: Waste and Disposal Services
description: Providers of pollution control and environmental services for the management, recovery and disposal of solid and hazardous waste materials, such as landfills and recycling centers. Excludes manufacturers of industrial air and water filtration equipment, which are classified under Industrial Machinery.
